lead_paragraph: SMYLIE--The Reverend Robert F.,87 and a resident of Seabrook Village in Tinton Falls, NJ, passed away on Saturday, December 19, 2015. He was born in Memphis, Tennessee; grew up in St. Louis, Missouri; and spent most of his adult life living in Englewood, NJ and working in New York City. A graduate of Washington University, Robert was an ordained Presbyterian minister with a Masters in Divinity and Theology from Princeton Theological Seminary and a Masters in Philosophy from Columbia. A lifelong student of international affairs, world traveler, and advocate for peace and human rights, he had spent 27 years with the Presbyterian Church USA's Peacemaking Program in several capacities before retiring as the Director of its United Nations Office in 2002. He had also served as a US Navy chaplain, taught at the University of Florida as an Assistant Professor in Social Sciences, and had been a Visiting Fellow at New College, University of Edinburgh in Scotland. Robert was a widower; his wife, Yuri Yamamoto, was a concert pianist and teacher. He is survived by his sons, Mark and John. A memorial service is scheduled for 11am, Saturday, January 16, at First Presbyterian Church in Englewood, NJ. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Memorial Scholarship established by the family of his grandniece, Rachel G. Smylie, at the charity Geography of Hope. 1/3
